description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Microsoft ODBC driver remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-26159), it is crucial to apply the relevant security updates provided by Microsoft. Follow these steps to ensure your system is secure:

1. Identify the appropriate update based on your Windows version:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2, apply KB5035853.
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2, apply KB5035854.
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2, apply KB5035854.
   - For Windows 10 (x64), apply KB5035858.
   - For Windows 10 (32-bit), apply KB5035858.
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 (x64), apply KB5035845.
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2 (x64), apply KB5035845.

2. Download the update package from the appropriate links:
   - [KB5035845](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035845)
   - [KB5035858](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035858)
   - [KB5035853](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035853)
   - [KB5035854](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035854)

3. Install the updates and restart your system to apply changes.

**Details**:
This update addresses the remote code execution vulnerability identified in the ODBC driver, which is critical for securing your Windows environment against potential exploits. Ensure that you are running a compatible build listed above to successfully apply the patches.

**Preconditions**:
- Backup critical data before proceeding with installation.
- Ensure your system meets the version requirements prior to applying the updates.
